column15:
A committee of the Southern Tasmanian Councils Authority, the Regional Climate Change Initiative was established in 2010. The Regional Climate Change Initiative aims to provide leadership, and facilitate collaboration on and coordination of climate change activities across the Southern region.

The Home Energy Audit Toolkit (HEAT) was one of its previous projects.

column4: Bulk purchase programs of household energy efficiency products
column6: Communities could bulk purchase solar panels or solar hot water for a group discount.
column15: This initiative was one of the previous projects - see above.

column6: Residents can borrow the toolkit free of charge.

Kingborough Council and other councils partnered with Sustainable Living Tasmania’s ecohomeguide.com.au to create the Home Energy Bulk Buy for energy-efficient heat pumps, hot water services, insulation, LED lighting, solar panels and other products.
column15: The Home Energy Bulk Buy was available at the same time as the Tasmanian Government’s Energy Efficiency Loan Scheme that had three-year interest-free loans of up to $10,000 for individuals to install energy-efficient and renewable-energy equipment.

column6: Residents can borrow the toolkit free of charge.
column15: The Home Energy Audit Toolkit (HEAT) was developed by the City of Hobart in collaboration with the Southern Tasmanian Councils Authority’s Regional Climate Change Initiative.

column6: Hobart City Council and other councils partnered with Sustainable Living Tasmania’s ecohomeguide.com.au to create the Home Energy Bulk Buy for energy-efficient heat pumps, hot water services, insulation, LED lighting, solar panels and other products.
